title: International Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Series of 3 interviews with all levels of the team from Operational Support to Directors. Repetitive series of common interview questions at every interval assessing soft skills, conflict management, and cultural fit. After 3 interviews I was ghosted and never provided with an update, feedback, or proper rejection of my candidacy. Ghosting a candidate after a month of interviews is particularly unprofessional and my guess, is indicative of a less than agreeable team to work with.
Interview Questions: Why Mass General? Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker. How comfortable are you with Outlook?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Salem, MA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Worked as travel RN for a year previously. Applied for ICU position. Quick and easy. Talked with HR at first. Offered job on the spot. HR stated if job acceptance, the floor manager will calk to give information about the floor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in ICU?

title: Admin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. I was asked typical interview questions, why do you want to work here, difficult client you handled, conflict resolution examples, describe someone you admire, and why, what your salaey requirements are.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer introduced herself. Interviewer gave brief history of MGH. Interviewer began to ask professional and direct questions. The first question was, Tell us about yourself. This, of course, being the very meat of the matter, so, I spent the next 10 minutes enumerating my past work history.
Interview Questions: Tell us about you Why do you want to leave your current job? What can you do for us that others cannot? Do you have any questions for us?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone screen request a few days later. After the screen, was asked to do a Zoom interview with managers. Requested references a few hours after the interview, and within two weeks had an offer. The recruiters were in contact with me the entire time and were very responsive. Overall a really quick and easy process!
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving current job?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: First they emailed and sent out options to schedule a phone call. They accommodated as I had no phone access and we did a Zoom call. From there, simple, they provided information on positions available and where might be a good fit and passed my resume off to those departments.
Interview Questions: Name three strengths that may help you in this position.

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Super easy, just behavioral questions. It was a co-op so through my university. The interviewer was very nice and I got my acceptance the day after. I wouldnt stress too much!
Interview Questions: Skills and Weaknesses Tell me about yourself Why MGH

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward and informative. Was able to meet the team and discuss the responsibilities and expectations within the role. Communicated effectively and gave clear and concise answers to my questions. (multiple rounds)
Interview Questions: Under what circumstances have I worked with people who come from a different origin or background than mine.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It started off with a 15-minute HR interview with very straightforward standard questions (why do you want this job? what skills and experiences do you bring to it?). Next, I had an interview with the program director (a doctor in this case) and she was so kind and really took the time to talk with me, it felt more like a conversation than an interview. Next, they asked me for references (4 total), and they each had to fill out a survey, and they all filled it out they also called of them. I haven't heard back yet, but fingered crossed that I get this one!
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Salem, NH) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was brief. The interview was friendly and informative. I was told that I would hear back from the HR department by end of the week. Did not hear back and I had to call back and find out the status. I was not selected for the second interview. The overall process was positive and fair.
Interview Questions: What were my qualifications Why I wanted to work for the organization Why I applied for this position

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Pretty laid back just questions about why i want the job as this role and in this particular department (cardio thoracic surgery). Moving onto second stage soon. First stage was two CRCs and second is the full team
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Why this department?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Virtual Call with the hiring manager that went on for 30 min. I was asked about my experience and some behavioral questions and how would i be suitable for this position,
Interview Questions: How will your extracurricular activities help in your job

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial interview with a current CRC and the program director. That was mostly behavioral questions and them giving more information about the position. The vibes were very lax, they seemed chill.
Interview Questions: Do you like working better individually or in teams and how do you approach each situation?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process really depends on the lab/team you are applying to work for. I have interviewed for several positions and they were done differently. Number of interviews and how spaced out they are varies.
Interview Questions: (Basically) Tell me about yourself.

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview for clinical role, RDs first round of interview then upper members of team for second round of interview. Place high value in how well you’d fit within a team in outpatient setting.
Interview Questions: Less clinical questions and more patient interaction/experience questions

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Lots of interviews but generally easy, typical questions. Mostly wanted to get to know me as an employee as well as a person! Interviewed with HR, department manager, team nurses, and team CRCs
Interview Questions: How do your past experiences make you a good candidate for this role?

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received a call to interview about 2 weeks later. The interview was with 6 of the nurse managers in the OR and the nurse educator. Walking in was a bit intimidating, but everyone was engaged and kind. I received an email a little over three weeks later saying that HR would be contacting  the following week with next steps.  The HR represesentative was incredibly condescending and frankly rude.
Interview Questions: If we asked a coworker one of your biggest strengths what would they say?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Two-part interview. The first was a phone call discussing qualifications and the second was a tour of the lab. Very thorough and the interviewer requested a list of three relevant references. Not a difficult interview if you have the qualifications.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a lengthy presentation, went well overall, interviewers were friendly and had good questions about my resume and projects. Overall pretty calm and manageable. Heard back within two days and took the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you've worked on that was intellectually challenging

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took two steps, the first interview was with other clinical research coordinators and if you moved on past the first round the second interview was with the principal investigator.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to take leadership

title: PSCIII Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with both the Nurse Practitioner and staff coordinator at the Vascular Surgery unit. The interview was fairly standard and cordial. It was not incredibly difficult although standard interview questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: the process started with an initial phone screen with the manager of the lab (about 15 min long), then an interview with my PI (about 30 min long), and the offer came three to four weeks after initial interview with info about salary, benefits, etc.
Interview Questions:
1. What are your future educational plans?
2. How does this role fit into those plans? 
3. Behavioral scenario about dealing with a difficult coworker
4. Any questions I have about the role

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and fast interview process. Conducted interviews virtually and was hired within a few days. The questions were very person and experience focused. Allowed me to elaborate on my answers and were very receptive to everything I had to say.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview about interview 2 weeks after applying, received job offer 1 week after applying, reference check and background check. The process took a long time but went relatively smoothly.  This all happened quicker than average because I was an internal applicant and already in the Mass General system as an employee
Interview Questions: Tell me one thing that excites you about being a new grad RN

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Applied via partners site and was invited for an interview within 5 days of applying. 
Met with everyone in the lab short meetings and chats mostly. Interview with the PI involved talking about past experiences and future aspirations. Some scientific knowledge was also tasted like pathways and genes of interest.
Interview Questions:
Future plans 
Talk about pathway I studied 
Gene of interest I studied

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I had a first interview with Mass Gen for a short term analyst position.  The interview was promising and the recruiter was professional.  I was overwhelmingly qualified for the position.  Unfortunately they had just offered the position to someone else just an hour prior to my interview; we did the interview anyway in case that fell through but it didn't work out.
Interview Questions: Describe how your background is a good fit for this position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I went in for a in person shadow and interview. I got to get a feel of the floor itself and see if it would be a good fit. After I had an interview with the nurse manager of the unit.  I was asked at the end when I would potentially like to/be able to start.
Interview Questions:
Can you give me an example of when you believe you made a difference for a patient/family?

Tell me what brought you to this point now, as a nurse applying for this job?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
- discussed past experience / who I am
- explained why am I leaving my current job
- why did I choose nursing 
- what type of patients do I see at my current job
Interview Questions: what type of pts do you see

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Quick and efficient communication from HR; interviewer was transparent,  friendly, and asked relevant questions despite not being in the nursing field. Overall was a straight forward interview with no unexpected questions
Interview Questions: Conflicts with employers you worked out

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I talked with a lab manager then the PI on the phone and then over zoom about interests and the job description. It was pretty quick calls both times. I did not end up getting the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed once with the senior/HR manager then again for a panel interview. They used a lot of standard questioning, often extremely repetitive and did not make it into a conversation. Then there was a case study that you are expected to review. After that they told me it would take a few weeks to process (which is a long time) and then 1 month later still have not received any replies to follow up emails.
Interview Questions:
What technical skills do you have? 
What is your 5 year plan? 
Why are you interested in PM in a hospital?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews the first is with a group of current workers in this position and the second is an interview with the head of the lab I was applying for
Interview Questions: Experience on scientific method and availability

title: Patient Observer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy they ask you about scenerios regarding patient safety and about your availability.  Then they put you on the schedule. Shifts are usually Thur, Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation? ( patient safety)

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR, they set up an interview. It was very Conversational describes workplace, job roles and expectations. Job offer shortly after with benefits. Very easy process overall they are looking for nurses
Interview Questions: Your skills and your past job

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and smart interviewers who asked questions about my background experience and interest in the role, as well as future career goals. Also provided very honest thoughtful responses to my questions about the job, responsibilities, and culture within the team.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very seamless. Primary interview involved learning more about their research projects, my background and career goals and how I would contribute to their team. Asked about different roles I have performed in my career and what was the most challenging.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this team

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: first round interviews are quite standard. 15-30 minute phone interview with current CRC, asking you basic questions about your resume and research experience. must ask questions back to learn more about role
Interview Questions: why do you want this role

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: was very informal- did not ask much questions and called me through an unknown number, but the HR recruiter was very sweet about everything and explained the job as much as he could. when he couldn't, he set up a phone call with the nurse manager which was really sweet and professional.
Interview Questions: 1. What days can I work? 2. Tell me about your experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. Just generally wanted to get a feel for how I would fit into the unit. They asked about prior experience and what I would bring to this role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MGH?

title: PSR I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I met with the entire department and was interviewed all day. I met with all three departments that I was going to be working with. and each presented its own challenges.
Interview Questions: why are you the best person for the job

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview with a recruiter. Got a call back a couple of days later to schedule another one. I did not take the job as I was looking for a higher pay at that time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom chat as starter. Said there will be contact and updates but no follow up. 

First introduce yourself, then introduce your projects. Follow up/ demo your projects. Question about previous experiences.
Interview Questions: Explain your resume and projects. Some BQ and reverse BQ

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone conversation followed up with a lovely zoom interview. There were several people in the zoom meeting. Everyone got to speak and ask questions. It lasted for about 30 mins. I prefer this zoom interview over any I have had in the past.
Interview Questions: Give me three reasons you would be a good fit for the company?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I got a couple of questions off the reviews on Glassdoor, used them to prepare and the interview went quite really well. The interviewers were very professional, courteous and welcoming.
Interview Questions: How do you manage busy Principal Investigators?

title: Special Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: One round, relatively easy. very friendly environment if a bit simplistic in work load and effort. I was remote so different than normal experience but still extremely very valuable though
Interview Questions: what are you strengths and weaknesses

title: Executive Director Area Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. We coordinated an interview time and the interview lasted about 40 minutes. They later contact you about getting references and work history. They were also very responsive to any questions or concerns I had about the position.
Interview Questions: What is something you had to take responsibility for?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is usually with other clinical research coordinators and/or the principal investigator of the particular clinical research team. I have had pretty nice people interviewing me, felt pretty welcome.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Why are you qualified for this position?
What are your plans for the future?
Provide an overview of who you are.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was a zoom interview where they asked one question each, it was very casual. They were hiring from different departments and asked if I had a preference which was uncomfortable. It was only 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. How do you handle change?

title: CRC II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Fairly straight-forward and direct. No beating around the bush, expectations on what to bring to the interview (information) were given, and the hiring manager was honest with timelines on hiring and HR communication. 

Initial round was a phone screen, then there was a 5-hour interview portion (I believe this used to be a panel interview pre-Covid), that was several individual interviews over zoom with 15 minute breaks in between. 
It was nerve-wracking but everyone was kind and direct, and questions were straightforward.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your previous experiences in IT?

Q: Why are you interested in working in this department?

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very seamless and easy. All parties are extremely professional! Questions are straight to the point, and not meant to trick you. Definitely prep beforehand, and do not be afraid to take a moment to think before responding.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation of conflict with another employee?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard interview process. I first had a phone interview with one of the managers and then had in person interviews with 2 managers and the director of the team.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your organizational skills?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with appointment for in person interview following this.  Meeting with the program Director last. Interview process requested a writing sample and went relatively smoothly, I had an offer within two weeks following the interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Tell me about a difficult situation you encountered at work and what you did to overcome this?

title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Spoke for about 15 minutes on zoom typical questions like tell me about your background and what made you want to apply for this position. Pretty standard and striaght forward
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work  here

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Three separate, virtual interviews with individuals of increasing status. Took approximately 1 month in totality. Very friendly scientists. However there was a lengthy references process with quick turnaround. Was told I would hear back by HR but radio silence and difficult to get a response sometimes.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals? Why do you want to work in research?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a researcher from the lab. I met with the lab PI, and shared my academic and programming backgrounds. He and the lead on a project were happy with my background and gave me the position.
Interview Questions: I was not given any technical questions, only background questions related to programming experience.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of me giving a 45 talk, and then individual meetings with my supervisor and other members of the lab. Each person asked me similar questions about my PhD experience and my goals for my postdoc, as well as long term goals. They asked me what training I thought I needed.
Interview Questions: What are your specific long term career goals?

title: Radiology Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was strange on Zoom. Interviewers were pleasant and easy to speak with.  I was given an opportunity to ask question, which were answered in detail. Very quick but not lacking quality.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about yourself?

title: Research Engineer/Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two interview rounds, one with the team, one with the PI. Everyone was very nice and not intimidating. You could tell that they want you to grow as a researcher.
Interview Questions:
Project you're most proud of
Previous projects
Role in a team project

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was asked 11 questions, but they were not hard. The interview itself was pretty easy going and felt more like a conversation than an interrogation. She made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview with two supervisors. It was over the phone. They asked me several questions about my approach to the therapy process. I answered and they asked clarifying questions. It was moderately stressful, but in the end not difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe your modality and approach to psychotherapy.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: First, I spoke to the outgoing coordinators, who asked me a few questions, and then I had the chance to asked them questions, Then, I spoke to the nurse practitioners who manage the coordinators.
Interview Questions: Describe your approach to communicating with others

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview with HR and we went over my resume.  Then I had the interview with the floor I applied to over zoom with the nurse manager and clinical nurse specialist.  They asked the regular interview questions (tell me about yourself, your strengths, your weaknesses, an example of how you solved conflict) and they also gave multiple hypothetical scenarios and asked what I'd do.
Interview Questions: There is patient A with xyz going on, patient B with xyz going on, and patient C with xyz going on.  In what order would you go to each patient and why?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: fairly straightforward: you submit an application, answer a few questions in person, and shadow until you are ready to volunteer. the process could take a longer time depending on when orientation meetings are available.
Interview Questions: why do you want to volunteer?

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was in a happy environment, interviewed with both nursing director and clinical nurse specialist. Very easy to find the unit, direct questions were asked. Interview lasted for about forty-five minutes and was conducted on the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the ICU?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: They email you if they see, and like, your resume. The process is very quick. The first and second interviews happen days apart. The people I spoke to were friendly and nice.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was an Easy interview for a first out of college job . Met with 3 people who described the role and asked average interview  questions. Overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize competing tasks?

title: Marketing and Communications Manager, Think: Kids Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Long-drawn out process where I didn’t meet hiring manager except over the phone. Had phone interview, writing assignment and two additional rounds. Was unnecessarily long and odd to not have a video interview with the person who would be managing me. Process was 2-3 months.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Clinical Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and got an email to set up an interview a few days later. The interview was on the phone, where I was given a brief description of the job and more info about the hospital itself. I had some questions about the job that I thought were good ones to ask but I was told they didn’t know the answer. They said that the managers would be good to ask and that speaking with them would be the next steps. That sounded very positive and I thought the interview went well and sent a thank you and a follow up. No response.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was a two round process, they actually got back to me within a week because I told them I had another offer(which was true). They made sure to give me an answer before that deadline.
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses, why i wanted to work there

title: Social Work Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was definitely intimidating. Know your stuff regarding the hospital/ the program applying for. Know the hospital message. Ask questions. Dress professional and well groomed. Have case examples ready.  It was intimidating meeting with a group of like 4 people against just yourself but everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: What do you like about this program

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involves screening, scheduling, and conducting interviews to assess candidates' qualifications, skills, and fit for a position. It includes various stages like phone screenings, in-person or virtual interviews, and reference checks.
Interview Questions: SQL joins Python Data related questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen early on, followed by a zoom interview with recruiting department/members of the department, followed by interview with members of the lab. The whole process took about 1 month. The interviews were around 45 min- 1 hour long each.
Interview Questions: What was one initiative you took to improve the workplace?

title: Sr. Grants Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: MGH recruiter invited me to apply for the position. I went through two video interviews with various members of the team/PI's and it was all in all a smooth process
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for another position?

title: Crnp Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: (5) interviews with administrative personnel. All extremely professional, welcoming, and relaxed. Answered all questions without hesitation. Transparent about role, expectations, and the mission of the department and hospital as a whole.
Interview Questions: 5 year plan for the future

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Connected by a recruiter to come in and interview with the hiring manager / supervisor.  Unfortunately radio silence from them in the weeks following and did not answer follow up emails which is frustrating.
Interview Questions: Do you perform better individually or as a team member?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Not too intensive. Video call with PIs, second interview with other coordinators, and references needed. Applied, then took around 2 months to hear back, but after that it took 2 weeks to hiring.
Interview Questions:
When was one time you dealt with conflict?
Talk about your leadership experience.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
January 2020 Process
First, I was invited to a zoom meeting with 5 of the team members in the research lab. After, I was scheduled with an interview via zoom with the PI of the lab one-on-one.
Interview Questions:
First: Tell us about yourself.
What do you see yourself doing in the next 5 years?
What experience do you have that is relevant to this lab?
What do you seek to gain with working in this lab?
What are things you love about research? What are things you don't love so much?

title: Clinical Practicum Intern Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about my experience, qualifications, and wanted to know why I was interested in that specific position. Overall fine but had to reschedule multiple times which was frustrating and felt like my time was disposable.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was dragged out for 11 months because of COVID. All interviews were conducted remotely, the final being a 2-hour panel discussion. The communication by MGH over those 11 months was subpar, as I was the one who had to keep reaching out to check in. I was confident with my interview performances, and am ultimately relieved I did not get the position because it means I have a chance to land with colleagues who are good communicators and always of top of things.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you were under pressure and how you handled it? How would your former employer describe you in three words?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

title: Web Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I went through three rounds with the MGH Ambulatory Management Team, one round being a two hour interview panel and a written test where they asked me for consulting advice for their website and newsletter content. I was floored after I interviewed for the final round and was ghosted. I completely understand not getting an offer, but to not get a rejection notification after interviewing for 4+ hours with the team and providing a written test submission (unpaid work) was very unprofessional on their part.
Interview Questions: How would you improve our website?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick response and good communication throughout.  It was a 3-step interview, all held over Zoom.  The first interview was with the hiring manager and was quick and straightforward.  The second interview was with the core team and went very well; interesting conversation.  The final interview was with another, related team who seemed disorganized and disengaged.  My questions were answered in a few words with limited detail, and one of the interviewers was looking at her phone almost the whole time and  kept asking me to repeat myself because she wasn't listening.  At one point I was asked to identify the "diverse" characteristics of my prior team, which felt like a very restrictive/tokenizing way to go about that topic.  I left the final interview uncomfortable with their lack of engagement and concerned with the limited way they wanted to address important topics in the DEI&B space.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

I wish they had reimbursed my travel since Boston is very expensive and they insisted I come visit and stay several days. Also, if you don't have an internship after graduating, you aren't actually interviewing for Med Tech I, you're interviewing for a lower position with a big drop in pay, and can move up to Med Tech I after one year. Still worth it since it's better than an unpaid internship, but I didn't expect it. Management was really nice and easy going. Interviews were fairly casual and just required some basic preparation prior to.

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted to schedule an interview via e-mail shortly after I submitted my job application. It was subsequently rescheduled twice (I guess it happens). 

I was originally supposed to be interviewing with 3 people, but ended up talking to only one of them.

The interview  took about half an hour, it was a pleasant conversation. The interviewer made me feel at ease. He asked me to walk him through my resume (standart questions), then he asked a few statistics, data cleaning and machine learning questions to test my knowledge of the subject and to evaluate my thought process. He seemed to be satisfied with my responses. At the end I walked out feeling pretty good overall. 

Alas I did not get the offer. Not a big deal, part of the job searching game :) 
The only negative was that I did not get a rejection e-mail, nor any response after I had followed up with them. I figured after additional 4+ weeks of waiting, no response means 'no offer' which was a bit frustrating, but again it is not an uncommon way to turn down an applicant.
Interview Questions:
How to prevent overfitting of the data?
How to deal with data redundancy?
What methods of visualization would you use  to find outliers?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I've interviewed for MGH twice and have had negative experiences both times. First time (several years ago): I had a phone screen, then in person interviews with 4 or 5 people. I didn't hear back from the hiring manager or recruiter for weeks. I reached out to follow up by email and by phone and got no response. They did eventually call me to discuss next steps and an offer, but I had already accepted another position because I had assumed I'd been cut. 

I interviewed again a few months ago and the recruiter again disappeared. She never responded to email or voicemail requesting a brief update. I again accepted a position elsewhere. I never received any clarity on where I stood with MGH. 

I've enjoyed my in person/on site interviews and have been very impressed by MGH otherwise.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult patient experience? Why this specific job and specialty?

30 words is  a lot for a review

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2 weeks total.  I was contacted first by the current CRC for a short phone interview on a Friday. Then brought in the next Wednesday for an interview with the PI. The next day I was called by the hiring manager and offered the job contingent on my references.  The following Monday I received a call from the hiring that I got the position and on Tuesday morning I received the official offer from HR.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Grants Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for a phone interview almost a month later. The phone interview was with the Development Director for the department I would be working under. The interview was pretty standard but I was suprised how easy going he was and it was more like a conversation. Before we hung up we were already scheduling a second interview, in person. Two weeks later I flew up to Boston and met with the man I spoke to before (my boss) for about 20 minutes- didn't ask much interview questions cause he had previously. Then I went and met with the Senior Grants Administrator whom I would be working with and saw what my office would be and what not. Meeting with her was more so for her to see if she could work with me side by side each day so pretty relaxed. Then I the last person I met with was the lead Doctor of Surgery for the Center of Transplantation Sciences and was pretty brief. He asked about my experience and really wanted me to thoroughly explain it. Then the following day I was contacted by someone from HR to submit my references 2 days later they were contacted and the following week I received a job offer.
Interview Questions:
Past experience
Organizational skills
Strengths/ Weaknesses
What I want to learn
Why I should be hired
What I bring to the table

title: Patient Service Coordinator III Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through indeed, and found a doctor's email online to send in my resume that way as well. My resume was circulated through the department, and I was invited for a phone screen for a couple of different projects. I then had Skype interviews with the doctor and 2 CRCs, and then was invited for an in-person interview. I interviewed with 4 different people from the team. It was very casual, a lot of questions about my previous experiences and transferable skills, and just seeing if I was a good fit for the team.  It was a great experience, my only concern was the pay - which was not up for negotiation at all, and I when I tried to ask for more, it sounded like HR was trying to devalue me as an employee and act like they weren't almost 10k less than the average in the area. For someone with student loans and paying rent anywhere near Boston, it's going to be difficult to swing, but I took it because I really enjoyed the team and the job description.

title: Education Coordinator Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by someone to do a phone screen. This department received my resume from a previous interview I had at MGH (and did not get the job). I did a 30 min phone call with another CRC. It was pretty easy, just answering questions to clarify my skills and talking about my experiences and resume. I was then asked to come in for an in-person interview a few days later. When I arrived, I met with 4 different people separately. Everyone was extremely nice and welcoming, so I did not feel anxious during the interviews. I met with the manager last, and at the end, she said the next step was to be contacted by HR and do a reference check. The reference check took about a week. I was then contacted to set up a time to talk to the manager, where I received an offer for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your most recent research experience.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I found the job through indeed.com and applied on the company's website. I honestly forgot that I applied to this job. There is no way for the applicant to contact HR or hiring manager. After about 2-3 months, I heard back from one of the doctors to schedule a phone interview. I passed the phone interview and 2 week later, I schedule and in-person interview. I was interviewed by the attending doctor, a fellow and another clinical research coordinator. It took about 1 hour.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this job?
What are the qualifications that make you a better candidate?
what are your interest in life (hobby/career)
How do you respond in certain situations? (I was interviewing in a department that work with patient who are severely ill, so a question about death threw me off guard). I have no experienced death in my family (thank God); so I did not know how to respond to that. Be ready for those kind of questions.

The interview lasted approximately 1 hour. I received an offer a few weeks later. I was never warned about having to interview in front of more than just the nurse manager- I was completely taken by surprise.

The interview itself was conversational and I feel I learned as much from them as they did from me. The next day I was contacted for references. A really nice experience.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume and was scheduled an interview for 11am on a Friday with Judit Sore. Got there 10 minutes early and ended up waiting 20 minutes before I was actually seen. I had to tell someone to get her while she was speaking to someone in the office. She came out and said "you're the 11am right?". She then took me to the lobby and sat me down and asked me a few questions and tried to scare my off from the job saying that there are a lot of compliance issues and that it is a highly stressful job...  Then she proceeded to put words into my mouth and accuse me of being an under-qualified applicant saying that I did not have any work experience. Graduating from college what did she expect. I am not bitter about not getting the job and i did make mistakes during the interview but I do not think that gives her the excuse to disrespect someone because of it. Do not ask for an interview if you do not see me as a qualified individual, do not waste my time by making me wait and most of all respect the people around you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the job.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: tell me about yourself?  tell me about customer service? how is your team work ?They asked me if I knew anyone who worked for the company. I told them I did. They asked me if I knew the rates for home health visits. The manager then quoted me incorrect lower rates. I actually did know what they were paying before my interview. I lost respect for the company after that. The rates per visit were lower than I would have accepted...AND THEY TRIED TO OFFER ME A LOWER RATE THAN THEY PREVIOUSLY PAID NURSES!!

Interview Questions: Why are you qualified

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy, the professor only asked some basic questions, such as solving a quadratic function, MCMC, and my projects. Although my answer to technical questions is right, my previous backgroud in hardware design is not mached with his offered position. In all, the discussion was really great.
Interview Questions:
solve quadratic function

MCMC

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online, and then I got an email about a phone call with one of the senior coordinators, then later got another email about scheduling an interview with them in Boston.
Interview Questions: What is a mistake I have made?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was referred, met with a coordinator. A couple weeks later I had a phone interview, and after following up was invited for an in-person interview. A month later and 2 more follow up emails I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What helps you succeed in a clinical research coordinator position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a short phone interview and was asked to come into the office. The first interviewer I spoke with was very friendly and asked me a few basic interview questions, and gave me a detailed job description. Then I spoke to the associate program director and she immediately asked me to describe everything that the previous interviewer told me about the job. I did not get the position—my tip would be to take short notes during the interview, which I did not. Both interviewers wanted to know my weaknesses, and this question seemed very important to them.
Interview Questions: Describe this position to me in detail.

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: i applied online and the recruiter contacted me for phone screen. The interview went well and we did discuss about salary. The interview was about my career experience, and why do i think i am qualified and why am I interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was referred by a friend to contact the research coordinator. Did not even apply to the job since I couldn't find the application online but after I was in contact with RC I didn't need to. First there was a general phone screen about why I was interested in the internship and then an interview which I did via Skype since I was studying abroad. The interview wasn't bad although mine could have been shorter since it wasn't in person
Interview Questions:
What brought you to apply to Mass General Hospital for research specifically?
Why are you interested in (whatever area you applied to) type of research and how does your experience back this up?
What other research experience do you have?

title: Animal Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Spoke on the phone with hiring manager and then went in for an interview a week later. You sit down with a group of managers and they talk to you about the position and what your responsibilities would be. Then they ask you questions about yourself and questions about different scenarios. Afterward, you are given the chance to ask the managers questions about the job. Once this process is over, you are given a tour of one of the facilities. This concludes the interview and then it's just a matter of waiting to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you had a conflict with a coworker and what did you do to resolve it.

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One day, 5 interviewers, follow up with HR for salary negotiations, 1.5 day orientation. skills test, background check, no drug test. Generally cordial, took 4 hours, was on schedule. Inerview on location,  one interview with remote employee via Skype
Interview Questions: Database Development Skills, Prior Exposure to Health Care

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had brief interview with the HR recruiter, which went very smoothly.  Few minutes later, I received a call from the hiring manager, requesting in person meeting.  Everyone in the office was professional, and respectful.  The meeting took about 45min, it was mainly a discussion format.  I learned lot about the organization, and they lean a lot about me.
Interview Questions:
- Do you have any questions about the job description?
- What is your day like at your current job?
- Why are you leaving?
- Who do you report to at your current job?
- How do you learn?
- What is your time-frame?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after emailing the PI. Came in to meet him + the other researchers in their office at MGH. Was very helpful that I had read the entirety of their publications ahead of time. Would recommend doing so to anyone who is interested in a research role. The two most important qualities they were looking for were being 1) personable and 2) detail-oriented.
Interview Questions: Talk about your research experience.

title: Radiochemist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got an email a few days later. It was about a 2h long in person interview. The interviewer was rather aggressive and tried to establish that the position was going to be extremely stressful (unless you have survived war, you don't know what stress is).
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you (looking for an answer that could not be found on the resume)

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application on MGH career site, received request for phone interview a few days later, a few days after phone interview, was contacted and asked to come to Boston for an in person interview with the team. Met with four different individuals who were all part of the team over 1.5 hours.
Interview Questions: What is a mistake you have made in your professional life?

title: Staff Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long but you got to meet with a lot of people to get their insight as to how it is to work here. The same questions asked by multiple people was very repetitive.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work here?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: interview process was quick and easy, depending on the position they have you interview with the doctor you may be working for.  Everyone is very friendly. Don't be intimidated
Interview Questions: Do you have hospital experience

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The PI e-mailed me to meet him at his office. It was a smooth interview with lots of questions about my experience and analytical skills at the lab. He went through my CV and asked what I contributed to some of my major publications. He gave me a tour of the lab and introduced to some of his lab members.
Interview Questions: Mainly about my research experience and my collaboration with my coworkers.

title: Medical Assistant Gastroenterology Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview after submitting my resume. When I sat down with dept manager we exchanged a few pleasantries. She had a copy of my resume in front of her. She said to me " Let's start with you telling me what you did after  graduating high school." (I am 45 years old) I proceeded with my past 27 years when I noticed she was sleeping for about a minute. Then when I was talking about my career that was on my resume she was getting it all confided. She took a few more minute more cat naps. She was then called out to resolve an issue with a patient. She asked me to wait in the waiting room where I could see her resolve the matter with the patient. The patient left and I waited an hour on the waiting room. She then was walking by and notice me with a look of surprise. (Like oh no I forgot I was interviewing before I just took an hour long nap). She came over to me and said she would not be able to continue with the interview and would call me.  A week later she called and asked if I could send her a copy of my resume. I did not
Interview Questions: What I did after graduating high school 27 years ago

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: 4 interviews that lasted at least 2 hours each. I interviewed on the phone and through Skype. I also interviewed with the direct manager, and human resources. I suggest you plan your day around the day of the interview since it took so long.
Interview Questions: Why MGH?

title: Senior Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Burlington, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied directly to by gmail to a Human Resource Person in August . She replied  7 days later . After reviewing my resume, the HR person thought I was a good candidate and set up a phone screen. The interview was arranged via email for the following week.
Interview Questions: It was a phone interview. I discussed the nine years of project experience I had had thirteen years ago in depth. I also discussed my recent 9 months of project experience.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were a couple of phone interviews, and because I was located far away, they were able to let me do a Skype interview instead of paying for me to come in.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to manage multiple projects at a time, and how did you handle that?

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: HR department will contact you and conduct a brief phone interview. If HR thinks you are a great candidate then they will set up an in-person interview with the nurse manager of the unit applied for.
Interview Questions: What do you do now for work? Why are you looking to leave current employer?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The application was accepted through email or online. There is short interviews with PI and lab members. Then, scientific presentation for the unit members.  The presentation time is about 1 hour including question and discussion.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply?

title: Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Must have open availability, rotating shift is the norm. Remember to dress professionally, show respect, and have a positive outlook. Obviously, it is like most interview processes with the employer trying to get to know you as a potential employee. So be prepared to answer questions about yourself and your future plans.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a cover letter and resume on hr website, contacted by project director by email, spoke with director over the phone and came in to the office to interview twice
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the field?

title: Data Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had multiple interviewers. The reactions seemed a bit mixed. They claimed they wanted someone more towards financial instead of research but kept asking about research. Asking too much of the position; data analyst plus programmer although position is for an analyst.
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to defend your position and how did you do it?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the office manager, the director of the practice, three nurses, and then I was called by HR, and offered the position. I was offered less money by HR than discussed in the interview. I called the office manager to question the change in what was discussed? She took care of the issue and I was given what I was initially offered.
Interview Questions: What I brought to the table? Why me?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward interview -- met with the nurse manager on the unit. They look to hire nursing students or long-term PCAs. We met for 20-30 minutes and discussed my experiences with patient care.
Interview Questions:
Why MGH?
Tell me about a difficult patient situation you had to deal with?

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the financial and administrative director first thing in the morning. Afterwards, I met with the Principle Investigator of the lab and finally all of the lab members
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness/ strength? What is a obstacle that you faced in your last job that you overcame?

title: PSC II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview after being referred by a friend to bulfinch temp, started as a temp and applied for a perm position after one year and got it. Very positive people with very high standards.
Interview Questions: good/bad qualities

title: Patient Services Coordinator/Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted via phone by the Hiring Manager who was very nice. Set up an interview for a few days later. Interviewer seem very unprepared and barely asked me any questions. She kept asking what questions I had, and I asked many--but still she asked me very little. Then, she had me meet with the other intake coordinators who were very nice. I then back went to her office and she told me there would be a second round of interviews the following week. The manager never followed up with me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very nice, went into the office. My interviewer was very nice and talked about how professional mgh is and it is special at the forefront of care and is the number one hospital. Asked questions about my experience working and experience and other parts of my resume. It is an intense place.
Interview Questions: Why MGH?

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer are doctors and software engineer. Even though some of them have no idea about technical term but they still be very friendly and ask what they really want I do for them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First I interviewed via phone with HR. Following that, I received an email from the manager on the unit I applied for which stated different times to set up an interview. Interviewed with the manager and then toured the unit. Within 1 week, I heard back from HR stating that I got the job which is when I decided to move forward with the offer. From the sending in my application to starting the job took about 1 month.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for MGH?

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 3 people, it was a very casual meeting. They asked me some hypothetical scenario questions and about my experience, as well as future career goals. They were transparent with expectations and are very interested in timelines of how long employees will stay.
Interview Questions: How to handle uncomfortable situations

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a positive one and quite simple. There were no intimate questions regarding how I would handle a bad situation or positive situation. They were nondiscriminatory and gracious. I was called for a second interview and received a phone call telling me that I was accepted for the job.
Interview Questions: Can I file. Am I computer savvy. Can I handle the commute into Boston. Am I available right away.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: sent in resume ~ 3 months ago..rec'd phone call from HR recruiter..was set-up for face to face interview with 2 directors, 5 staff members and 2 lead CM. was told by HR they would get back to me in a few days post interview but it is a month later, and, have not heard back either way..lead CM during interview thought I may have to come back and shadow another CM before they decided.
Interview Questions: What type of position are you looking for..describe your previous work experience. what type of CM model did you previously work in.

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was fairly long, but the supervisors were purely seeking if you’d be a good fit for the team and if you maintained loyalty in your career. It was basically a personality interview!
Interview Questions: What is a MCV?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I emailed the director of the laboratory myself after applying to the job online.
The job description said that it had a preference for a candidate with a Master's Degree, thus I qualified as a good candidate for this position, and thought that the compensation would be reasonable and parallel to the requirements that they had put on the job description.
The lab PI thought I was a good match for the position, and told me to come in for an interview.
The administrator scheduled the interview for me 2 weeks later, and I interviewed with 5 people one on one , on the same day for about 3 hours. Even though the interview process was intense, it went well. They asked for my references, I send them the references on time. I waited  6 weeks to hear back from them, where they offered me the position, and was told that the HR was going to be in contact with me. A week after the HR didn't reach out as of yet, so I had to get in touch with hiring manager once again. Finally HR called me and when they did they had all the wrong information, and were making me an offer for a different part time position. I had to wait another week until they clarified things out with the hiring manager , and then I was contacted again, and the offer that they made  for a position that is within the range of $45K, was $31,900, and this apparently was based on some calculations the HR did. I had applied to similar positions in hospitals where they didn't even require or prefer a Masters degree , and the offer was 14 thousand dollars higher, at least. Anyways I told the HR, I would get back to them the next day, and when I called the next day to decline the offer, the HR now said offer was $31,200. I do not know what was going on, but there was no consistency, and the whole process was certainly not a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a previous experience where you had to resolve a conflict with your supervisor?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively quick and easy. I applied online and heard back within a week. Had an interview over Skype with two CRCs who were very friendly. They asked about my previous research experience, my interest in their Center, and some behavioral-type questions and about future goals. Types of questions asked: Why do you want to work at MGH? Tell us about yourself, your research. Tell us about a time you experienced a conflict at work and how you resolved it. What do you do for fun?
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MGH? Tell us about yourself, your research. Tell us about a time you experienced a conflict at work and how you resolved it. What do you do for fun?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Sent them my resume and heard back within a couple days. They asked to schedule an interview for about a week later. The interview was pretty easy. The CRCs mostly wanted to go through each of my research experiences and the skills that I learned from them. They also went over their general responsibilities for the various studies that were going on in the lab. I met with the PI last. My conversation with him was about the same as the one I had with the CRCs, but we also went into my academic background, interests, and plans for the future.

After the interview, they told me the process would be finalized in a few weeks, although it ended up taking 2 months. They asked for my references and HR contacted me about a formal application and references.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience. Tell me about your academic background. When will you be able to start? Do you have any questions about the lab?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Email followed by phone call. Came in for interview to the lab. Discussed skills and fit for role. It was a pretty straight forward process. I am sure it is different for every lab. Salary and terms laid out. Got job on same day.
Interview Questions: How much lab experience do you have in a lab

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour in person interview, there was no phone screening. I met with 6 different people and overall the interview was pretty laid back. Was able to ask a lot of questions. There were no technical questions, all basic resume interview questions.
Interview Questions: How do you take instructions?

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short, simple to the point. Interview is more of an acclimation and getting to know you, seeing if you're a good fit for the job. It felt more casual and comfortable.
Interview Questions: What do you do in certain emergency situations? (Such as patient coding and you're in the room.)

title: Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Medford, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Takes a while to get called for interview.  It's a bit of a long process.  They are very nice and professional.  Job and training process are explained in detail.  Once you get an interview it's an easy process.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose MGH?

Are you flexible as to days and hours?

What salary are you looking for?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview and then I was invited in for in-person interview with project coordinator and his manager.
