We discussed my resume and thoroughly went over the requirements for the position, as well as room for growth within the position. They both asked typical interview questions
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with an unruly customer or patient

title: ECare Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from HR. She asked me several questions and scheduled me to meet with the nurse manager. I got there and she didn't know I had an interview or had a copy of my resume. The interview went great and I got a tour of the unit. She called HR immediately after we were done. I didn't hear anything for a week, then got an email at 10pm saying they chose someone else. I honestly think they forgot about me all together.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this type of nursing?

title: Clinical Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great interview. Very thorough with description of job role. Easy-going rapport. Was asked about skills obtained at previous jobs and what I have learned through academics. I shadowed and it was a very nice and diverse group.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the department

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to schedule a phone interview, as I was out of state. The phone interview with the Principal Investigator (PI) went well, so I emailed him the next day thanking him and expressing my interest in the position. About a week or two later, I followed up and we scheduled an in-person interview. I traveled 7 hours and the interview lasted about 3 hours. I was shown all the labs. I returned home, thanked the PI, and expressed my interest in the position once more. About a week later, I received an email stating that I was being offered the position. A week or two later, I received a phone call from the HR department stating that someone else had been hired who had more experience than I did, and who requested a significantly smaller salary offer. I was shocked by their lack of professionalism.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and very general. Met with the boss first. Then the director followed by all the different post-docs there. Everyone described their projects and their experience in the lab.This was followed by them asking me about my project, my interests. The post docs also showed me around the lab. This was followed by lunch.
Interview Questions: What motivated you to come to this lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I did my interview over the phone. It lasted about 45 minutes. The interviewer asked questions mostly about why I was interested in the research, my previous research experience, my experiences in dealing with challenges, strengths and weaknesses, etc. No questions that were particularly out of the ordinary. I had the opportunity ask many questions about the lab at the end, which was helpful because the posting did not contain much detailed information.
Interview Questions: Give me three words your best friend would use to describe you.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position, and received an email around a week later to set up a time for an in-person interview with the co-investigator for the lab. The interview was fairly standard: she had a copy of my resume and asked for more information regarding my education and previous experiences, asked the usual behavioral questions (where do you see yourself in 5 years, what are your strengths, etc.), and at the end, she went through all the duties a RA would be responsible for and gave a short tour of the lab. The entire interview took around 30-40 minutes. She emphasized the need to commit to the role for 2 years and told me she would get back to me within a week if I was selected for a final interview with the PI and RA that was being replaced (he chose to take a different career path). I received another email a little under a week asking to come in again for the final interview. I first met with the PI, who once again asked me questions about my resume, although more in depth this time, and went through some behavioral questions. A few of the questions overlapped with the last interview, a few were new. Still, none of the questions were unexpected at all. After about 30 minutes, she sent me to another room to interview with the current RA of the lab. He generally asked questions regarding my personality (what do you do when you encounter a problem, how do you deal with stress, etc.), and this lasted around 30 minutes as well. I was told I should get either an offer or rejection in 1-2 weeks, and after not having heard for over 2 weeks, I emailed them only to find out they had filled the position. I felt that all 3 interviewers were amiable and pleasant to talk to, and while I'm disappointed I didn't get an offer, the interviews were painless and enjoyable.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with having occasional evening/weekend hours and accommodating your schedule accordingly?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Emailed for an interview invite which was very brief (30 min). Talked about my background and what my future interests are. PI also talked about what projects they needed help with and expectations of the role. No phone interview. I had another interview with another lab in the same department (which I didn't get an offer for) but your hiring process experience will be highly dependent on the PI and the lab. Pay is not great but the rich environment makes up for it. You're surrounded by smart and great people (and equipment) 

Applied in early Sept, emailed back in mid Oct, started in Nov.
Interview Questions: What kind of data analysis did you do for your project in undergrad?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I registered for orientation, completed an online application (where they asked for staffing preferences), attended orientation, then signed up for an interview slot at orientation. To get the interview slot you really want, I recommend sitting in the front row at orientation. During the interview, if you can commit to a pre-designated time slot, you will get the position. With that said, after the interview, it was nearly 3 weeks later before I heard what my start date would be.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with kids?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about an hour. With questions from the director . After the interview questions. You go through each classroom; infant, toddler and preschool and spend some classroom time to see if your capable of working with kids.
Interview Questions: How would you greet the children in the morning?

title: Research Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and great enviorment. I enjoyed the atmosphere and everyone who I interviewed was very relaxed. They asked me what I want to do in my future. I responded.
Interview Questions: what do you see yourself doing in the future?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview initially. For the in person interview it began with a one on one with the PI, followed by a one on one with a post-doc, and then a group meeting with the other technicians.
Interview Questions: I was asked what I would like to achieve while working in their lab.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard Interview Process. Applied online on their website. 2 weeks later directly contacted by Investigator. Phone Interview followed by on site interview. Process was easy and straightforward. Met with few members of lab. general and HR based questions and not much technical. Visited the lab. The job duties are good and lot of opportunities to learn. However, they offer very low salary.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths ?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview first- only about 10 minutes-rapid fire but normal questions. Interviewers were not very personable or friendly. was invited for in person interview but was unable to attend my assigned time (due to it being during the middle of the work day) and they were unwilling to reschedule.
Interview Questions: what is your management style?

title: ECare Nurse Residency Program- Sept 2015 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, HR contacted me two weeks later for a phone interview. Basic questions about myself and why I wanted to work there. Scheduled an interview with the nurse manager a few days later. The in person interview consisted of her explaining the job, tour of the unit and two questions. This is a new grad position so there wasn't a lot of experience to talk about there. HR called me two hours after my interview asking for 4 references which were done online via skills survey. Never heard back for two weeks, called HR asking for an update and she updated me that I did not get it. Would have been nice to get a rejection email or something.
Interview Questions: What would your peers say about you? Whats a challenge you had to face?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Heard back around a month after I applied for the job. Had a in-person interview the next week. The interviewer either already had a candidate she wanted to hire or was just not prepared for the interview. Literally just asked 2 general questions - nothing specific pertaining to whether I would be a fit for the job, and asked her intern, who was in the room with her, if she had any questions for me. I ended up doing the asking. Was told she would get back to me the next week but never heard back. Overall, a frustrating experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were individual in  a round robin form with some of the PIs and research fellows. There were 6 candidates. First part was a tour of the lab facilities, then interviews then finally all 6 candidates met with the head of the lab and listened to him speak. Was asked for references, but did not recieve an offer.
Interview Questions: What are you future research interests?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: for the ecare residency program I sent in my resume was contacted by HR, then sent to interview w/ a director of a unit that I had interest on.
Interview Questions: What can I bring to the table that other candidates do not.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called by human resources, interview set up through human resources, met directly with the nurse manager. interview was standard with basic interviewing questions. have questions of your own. no tour of unit.
Interview Questions: what are your future career goals/plans?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the HR that my resume is selected. There was 2 rounds of onsite meeting. 1st meeting I visited the place and met the team. Team interviewed me for about an hour. I got clear for the second round and was informed about the same in 2 weeks. Before scheduling second round I was asked to submit 2 recommendation letter. For my second interview round I met the manager. The interview went on for 1 and half hour. I got cleared and was offered a job. The entire processing took 3 weeks. It was a long process. There was a lot of delay from HR side.
Interview Questions: My past and recent work experience, my graduate coursework, my interest in working in their lab. There were lot of behavioral questions as well to check my attitude towards work, my personality to work with others, what were my job expectations, how can I contribute to the team.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, Open ended questions, Asked a lot about my previous experience as a CRC, Ended up chatting about other things aside from the role. Pleasant experience with the PI and the program manager.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email about 5 days later & scheduled a phone interview. After the call, I heard back from them to schedule an in-person interview. Took about 2 weeks total.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you've been in & explain how you handled it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: not bad, took a week. trainings and hippa compliance. they had you do a phone screen and an in person interview. not too hard. took a week at max length
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applying was through the Partners job portal. Applied to many positions with resume and cover letter (got interviews for less than 10% of applications). Was called into the first interview and met with the current coordinator, and 2 other members of the team. About a week later, I got an email request for a second interview and met with the manager and the PIs and recieved the job offer the next day. However, it took about 2 weeks to get the offer from HR.
Interview Questions: What is your method of organization?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then asked to provide 3 references and writing samples, then was called in for an in-person interview.Phone interview, then asked to provide 3 references and writing samples, then was called in for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: How much GSI training do you have/

title: Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There's a phone interview and an in person interview. After I applied, it took a few days to get the phone interview, then about a month to get the in person interview. They told me I got the job about 2 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had to compromise with someone on something you disagreed with.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent a resume and cover letter to the principal investigator, who responded almost immediately, offering me a call, and if it went well, an in-person interview.  The call was relatively informal, mostly one of the current coordinators telling me about what their lab did, with a few questions about my career goals and why I wanted to work there.  After the call, I was offered an in-person interview, which was pretty short, mostly just fit questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with other people, specifically children?

title: Grant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position through the Partners career portal in October and didn't hear from HR until April. HR screened me with a phone interview and then I was asked to return for an in-person one on one interview with the hiring manager and a few others. After that, it moved quickly. The HR phone interview was standard behavioral questions and the in-person interview had more role-specific questions.
Interview Questions: Q: What experience do you have that would make you well suited for this role?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an onsite interview by an assistant of the lab and since I was unable to drive up to Boston that week I was given the option of a Skype interview. The interview was about 30-45 minutes in length and not very difficult it had some detailed questions pertaining to skills/experience and more behavioral questions, overall it seemed to have gone very well and I ended it feeling confident in either a follow up interview or perhaps even an offer. 2 weeks after the interview I followed up with the lab with an email to see the status of the position. In total it has been over 4 weeks since my interview and I still have not heard a response, which is very unprofessional, especially when it takes 2 seconds to send out an email with a simple update.
Interview Questions: Questions vary for each lab you apply to.

title: Bulfinch Temporary Employee - Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I transferred from a Full-Time employee to a Temporary employee so that I cold finish graduate school. The transfer was uneventful and was easy because I had 6 years of service. Mike knew me and was responsible for filling roles with an employee that he could count on. After my first job, he felt comfortable placing me in roles in or near executive suites at MGH and BWH.
Interview Questions: What would you like to do? Where would you like to work?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: 15 min personal introduction (both sides), 45 min technical questions. There were about 5 technical questions, one programming , the rest stats/ML like what is cross-validation or how do you control for overfitting in regression.
Interview Questions: Given an existing set of purchases, how do you predict the next item to purchase of a new basket?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to speak in detail about my past experience and was asked questions about my resume. They had questions prepared, but it ended up being more of a conversationally structured interview. They were already familiar with my experience and had clearly gone over my resume so we mostly discussed specifics. I was interviewed by several people in succession over the course of a few hours, each meeting was 1 on 1. My interviewers spoke a lot about the project and I was given a tour of the lab after we spoke, then I met other people in the lab. I was offered the position within 24 hours after the interview.
Interview Questions: What interests you about our project?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for an NIH fellowship and needed a research mentor. I applied to the laboratory of my choice and was given a phone interview. After which, I was asked for a site-interview where I toured the lab and spoke with all the lab members individually.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work in the laboratory? They also wanted to know some details about projects lifted on my CV. They also required a 45 minute presentation of your previous research.

title: CLA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nice. They allowed for me to interview with the hiring manager, current employees, and the department director all in one moment (which is a lot better than being called back for every step). Everyone was very kind and they were very prompt with their responses.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position? What skills can you bring to the position? What are your career aspirations and how would this position help you further those goals? How did you hear about this position? Tell us about yourself and where you see yourself in 5 years. What would you describe as your strength?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a phone call interview three days later that lasted around 30 minutes (with two interviewers), asked general questions in regards to resume, skills, and education background. Then got an in-person interview after two weeks and heard back a couple days later. Typical interview questions and orientation information about their lab, nothing too surprising.
Interview Questions: Tell me about this particular project- what were your roles in it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, cared very much about what type of person you are not so much can you answer technical questions.  Do ask some questions pertaining to past experience, but they try to get a feel for who you are versus can you recall a specific protocol.
Interview Questions: What I did on my free time.

title: RN- Travel Contract Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone only from Dept. Manager. The manager described the layout of the department, staffing ratio, professional staff available and specifically MDs of all levels on site at all times,  as is typical of teaching hospital. Gave me available shift options and options of number of hours per week available.  Stated a lot of positives about position to consider and flexibility of nurses to change schedule as needs vary.
Interview Questions: Can you handle a fast paced, high patient turnover environment

title: Clinical Trials Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (East Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through two rounds of interview. One of their regulatory affairs managers had a phone interview with me then I received the onsite invitation. The interview panel members were all very friendly, but I felt they were looking for someone has more integrated knowledge in all areas of clinical trials.
Interview Questions: use one word describes yourself

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (New Haven, CT) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 12 minute interview with senior management that involved asking questions about MGH, how you could contribute, and what you look forward to getting out of the internship. There was also an opportunity to ask one question at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in MGH?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with the Principle investigator is the first things happens if you are not in the US. Sometimes you will be required to come to the laboratory and have interview with all of the lab member entire of day and give a presentation in the lab meeting.
Interview Questions: Mostly technical questions

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview and it was fairly easy with straight-forward questions and interviewer was nice enough and was not trying to throw you off with unexpected questions or scenarios, typical interview
Interview Questions: Can you handle a high volume environment?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then got called in for an interview. The interview was about an hour long and they asked questions mostly about my past experiences and research skills. Everyone was very friendly. They are not making a decision immediately but said they will get back to me in a few weeks.
Interview Questions: no really unexpected questions

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Qualified for a telephone interview after submitting a cover letter, resume, and writing sample. Spoke in a conference-style manner with the project head and a current coordinator. Both took turns asking questions. Very open-ended.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about a prior research experience.
Why our lab?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 15 min Skype interview with all possible preceptors (about 8 of them). General questions about motivation and past experiences. They will interview about 10 people. Pretty high chance of getting the job once got an interview.
Interview Questions: why MGH, area of interests

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great. The process was short and very fair. I was told immediately after the interview what the outcome was. My interviewer was very polite and respectful. They basically just wanted to know what kind of project i wanted to undertake. They were very polite an professional. The interview started with me sitting in on a group meeting then meeting one on one with the team leader.
Interview Questions: Describe the project you want to do

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was supposed to be a phone screen because i was oversees. but ended up to only phone call because of internet connectivity problem from my side. we scheduled a few days before. interview was done on-time.  I was asked to talk about a bit from myself and a few questions from my CV and my previous research projects. then I was told about what they are doing, what responsibilities i would have there, with whom i would work and i also had the chance to ask questions. the interview was very patient (as I told there was internet problem from my side and I thought it might be affect negatively on the process of the interview)
Interview Questions: a brief summary of myself and research experiences, a brief summary of their projects and my role over there

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial phone screen with the Senior Project Manager in charge of the project. A week later I was called in for a three person Panel Review with Senior Management. They made a quick decision and I heard back from the Recruiter the same day after the final interview.  It took about 3 weeks from the initial interview to a job offer.  It took another week to complete the full background check and start employment.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation of how you handled conflict in  your previous position

title: Patient Observer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward and simple. It took only 1 day. It was well organized and all questions asked were related to the position. I gave a skill test after reading the job duties which helped me to get familiar with my possible responsibilities at work. The interviewer was very considerate and gave me enough time to respond. Also answered my all questions.
Interview Questions:
1.Why do you want to do this job?
2.Do you have any experience working in ER?
3.What are your 3 strength and 3 weaknesses?

title: Staff Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: applied online, 2 weeks later phone interview, 1 week later in person interview with manager and staff, online reference check, offer extended (pretty basic things as with any interview)
Interview Questions: all general basic questions

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer asked me about my past work and projects that I've worked on. She described the position and the skills that she was looking for. She also outlined the benefits and positive attributes of the department.
Interview Questions: What skills do you bring to the job?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went through a phone interview then an in-person interview with three people, 1-on-1 for each. We discussed my research experience and understanding, reasons for entering the field, and plans for the future.
Interview Questions: Please explain your previous research experiences and techniques.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly. Had 2 interviewers at the same time. Started off by explaining their backgrounds and current projects. Went in depth about what the position required. Asked about my background, education, experiences, and what attracts me to the position/why would I be great for the position. Ended with a tour of the office. Also requested 4 references.
Interview Questions: At the end of the interview, I was asked to send a writing sample.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then had a skype interview. Got offer. It was kind of sketchy since they literally gave me three days to decide whether to take it or not should have been a RED FLAG in my mind, but unfortunately I was a stupid recent graduate who panicked and accepted the first job I got.  if the interview process is this easy, there's bound to be a catch which I later found out (crappy benefits, low salary, bad work environment). Moral: See what else is out there and carefully investigate the position and lab before making a choice (as in actually talk to every person in the lab, this one lab hid away all the sad angry people so it looked like it was functional and happy). ALSO, note that other hospitals in the area have benefits that match what this place has to offer and the pay is often much better.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research experience

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy going atmosphere. the  manager was very down to earth and welcoming. she was very nice at explaining about the unit and what is expected of me
Interview Questions: Tell me a time, you went above or beyond for a patient?

title: Billing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 4 to 5 managers. Good process, great interviews, everyone was very pleasant. Questions are generally based on experience/background, behavioral based questions, and situational based questions. The interviewers (managers) have to all agree on a particular candidate in order to extend an offer.
Interview Questions: Questions are pretty much straight forward, aside from standard behavioral questions, nothing out of the ordinary if you can speak to your background and the job for which you are being interviewed.

title: Clinical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview and hiring process was fairly painless, with a fast reply rate.  The current clinical research assistant was very friendly and responded to my email. even gave me feedback on my interview when asked.
Interview Questions: the most difficult question I had was what would I do if a patient involved in my study for 20 years decided to quite what would I say

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone for a phone interview then met in person with two people in the department. The first interview was more general questions about why I wanted to work for the organization and the second interview was more specific about things on my resume such as explaining my research project
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had to wait awhile after submitting resume and application, but once I got a call back, the process was straight-forward. The interview was not too difficult, more just about getting to know the hiring managers.
Interview Questions: Why do I want the position?

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It took about two weeks after submitting my application to get an email from lab supervisor requesting a phone interview. The phone interview was brief and went well, so I was invited to come in for a face to face interview a week later. The next week I was offered the job and accepted, however it takes a month for HR and background checks to be completed. So start date is a month after job acceptance. Which is a bit inconvenient.
Interview Questions: How do you troubleshoot and give me an example of a situation. Walk me through it.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and heard back with a request for an interview about 3 weeks later. We scheduled an interview for the following week. The first round was about 45 minutes, with 2 employees who are of the same title as the job for which I was applying. They first asked me about myself and my resume and then moved into a section of behavioral-based questions. It was pretty relaxed and they were friendly. We then proceeded with an interview with the department head, with whom I spoke about my resume and general life (personal, school, and professional) with. It was an overall good experience but I withdrew my application because the salary was below what I could really accept.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations. Tell us about a time you failed and what you did about it. Several behavioral based questions but mostly standard in that respect.

title: Programmer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It took a little under two months for them to respond to my application. They contacted me via email and set up a phone interview for the next day, followed by a 4-hour in-person interview series a week later. The interview series was 8 30-minute interviews with the various faculty/staff. I appreciated only having to go in-person once. After that, I waited a week for a decision.
Interview Questions: They quizzed me thoroughly on my knowledge of programming topics.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process once called to interview.  Really difficult to get an interview here, though. They receive about 350K applications hospital-wide per year and hire less than 3,000 each year.
Interview Questions: Depends on the PI

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with Human Resources then about a week and half later a call for a physical interview.  After the physical interview with 5 people they called two weeks later and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit

title: R&D Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR manager interview, based on CV and previous conversation over the phone. A presentation was required about previous work, then I met the whole group and. Result was given within 2 weeks. Things were smooth and efficient.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with our company?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, 20min, pretty standard and chill - the interviewer asked about what attracted me to the position, what my qualifications, and career outlook. Most of it was me asking questions about the position (what does a typical day look like) and learning about the different aspects of the job.
Interview Questions: What made the position stand out to you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a different position and my application was forwarded to another person who had a postdoc position open. He spoke with a former coworker of mine whom he knew, and then contacted me.
Interview Questions: None really

title: Senior Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was Lengthy and included Many rounds. Fairly informal interviews. Most of the interviews were 30 minutes and intended to get to know me. Low pressure environment , but interviewers asked some questions about my interest in the work. Most people had not read my resume so bring copies. There wasn't extensive time to ask questions so come prepared with your top 2-3 questions.
Interview Questions: Why MGH?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was straightforward. I was contacted by phone to come in for an in person interview where I met my future coworkers, went on a tour and spoke with the head of the departments to discuss my qualifications and interests. Was called back a few days later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had two one-on-one interviews and an interview with the existing CRCs.   One of the individuals I interviewed with one-on-one was rude and condescending, barely made eye contact, and even checked their e-mail during the interview.  I was also asked an inappropriate question.  The other interviews were okay, and they gave me a good idea of what the job would be like.  However, it did not seem like a friendly work environment overall.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were predictable and not difficult.

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: worked with 1 PI. and other 3 lab members...Only Interviewd with the PI. How many people interview you Depends on the lab you might work for
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Observer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: call to schedule interview, scheduled interview than hired
Interview Questions: no difficult questions

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Application, followed by e-mail and Skype interview followed by an 1 day interview day including a 45 min. Presentation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Bulfinch Temporary Service Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Bulfinch Temporary Service (BFT) coordinator requested permission to send my profile to a faculty member who needed assistance with submitting several documents that comprise a grant proposal.  The position required experience with ensuring that federal funding agency specifications were met before submitting documents; I have relevant experience.  Upon receiving approval from the faculty member, the BFT coordinator arranged an appointment for us to meet.  The explanations were clear.  On the job, supervision by the faculty member was excellent.
Interview Questions: Communication was clear.  The interview and subsequent work was a rewarding experience.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Research presentations with whole group of researches and director of the department. They ask typical academic questions. Interview with the director of the department was a little intimidating, he only asked a couple of questions and the rest of the time, he kept asking me what can I answer for you. A particular principal investigator asked me illegal questions such as my citizenship and marital status, which I found very disrespectful. However, my direct boss was very nice and approachable and of course very smart. So, I decided to join after they gave me the offer.
Interview Questions: What other places are you interviewing at?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. They call you if they are interested in your resume. You do a telephone interview or two, they bring you in for a formal in-person interview, and then they call and let you know if they decide to hire you. Salary is almost always nonnegotiable. They are very tough about that here. Don't waste your time trying to prove otherwise. You are essentially being given the "gift" of working at MGH and having it on your resume. That's it.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest failure and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted a week after submitting my application. Invited in for interview without phone screening. Took two hours; met with four members of the team.
Interview Questions: "Where do you see yourself in five years?"

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Light, informal interview directly with PI, did not have to interview with any HR personnel. The interviewers were scientists and physicians who had obviously interviewed techs and post docs previously, but, having interviewed with professional hiring managers and other HR people for other positions, this was relatively low pressure and actually quite pleasant. They mostly want to get to know you and talk shop about experiences and goals.
Interview Questions: Describe a research experience where you solved a difficult problem.

title: Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 5 faculty members.  Most were very kind and proud of their program.  They answered questions honestly and provided access to other residents so we could get honest answers about what resident life at MGH is like.  Some interviewers were socially awkward, however.
Interview Questions: If you could be any musician, who would you be?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The Department conducted telephonic interview and then personnel panel interview with technical team. After this selection, it was  followed by interview with Director and telephonic  talk with HR
Interview Questions: Technical and managerial

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: dinner with current fellows and other candidates the night before the interview. one day onsite interview with a panel of senior leadership. key speakers and leaders are invited to present throughout the day while candidates are escorted to a 45 minute interview. reception at the end of the interview day
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a fellowship as the MGH

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied via company website with resume and cover letter.  Invite to interview.  Interview lasted half a day.  Decision 2-3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and did a phone interview within a week. HR person was very kind, and asked me questions regarding my background, but mostly asked me why I wanted the position. What my best traits were and what qualities/traits/skills I learned in my previous position. They offered me the position a week later.
Interview Questions: The questions were all easy. Be prepared to provide scenarios during in-person interview, but overall it was a very great experience.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Charlestown, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted directly by PI. Asked to submit references and invited in for a lunch interview the following week. Lasted about two hours. Fairly straightforward questions about my qualifications.
Interview Questions: What are your goals in life?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: applied online and was emailed to come in a month late, got a tour of the lab, had two 20 minute interviews with the head scientists in the lab, was emailed for references the next day, and received an offer by the end of the week
Interview Questions: Give me an example of your organizational skills

title: Statististician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first got a phone call asking if I was available to speak on a conference call with the team members (~8 researchers). Phone call was about an hour long and I was asked about my current job, previous experience, and asked about technical skills. After that, I had a very small group of team members with a presentation of a previous project I worked on followed by a question and answer session regarding the project.
Interview Questions: What was the decision for the modeling technique used?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: About a week after I applied to the CRC position online, I received a phone call from the Associate Director of the Clinical Trials Office and she conducted a brief phone interview and then scheduled an in-person interview.  At the in-person interview I spoke with the Associate Director again and she explained the position in more depth. Most of the questions she asked were the same questions she asked during the phone interview. After speaking with her, I met with a Senior Coordinator (who I would report to) and he asked fairly standard interview questions. Examples include: "What types of bosses have you worked with in the past?", "How would you rate your organizational skills on a scale of 1-10?", etc. They didn't ask any technical questions and there really weren't any difficult questions. It was a run-of-the mill interview. Both interviewers were pleasant and engaging.
Interview Questions: This isn't difficult at all. It's just another example of one of the questions they asked. What's your biggest accomplishment to date.

title: CRC II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Heard about the opening through school list-serv; submitted the resume directly to the head CRC; received email to set up an in-person interview; interviewed at MGH, toured lab, clinic, campus; heard back within 2 weeks from the head CRC, then from HR.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself. Generic interview questions

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online ad on jobs.phds.org for a postdoctoral position.  I explained my research background and interest in the project presented. The researcher in question liked my CV, and then requested my recommendations.  After receiving those, I was invited for an  on site interview.  The interview process consisted of a formal presentation (similar to a dissertation public defense), followed by a short Q&A.  I was then given 1:1 interviews with several other PIs in the group, the department chair, and then a few other postdocs in the lab.  I was given an offer letter a few days later, and accepted a few days after that.  Full time employment began several months later after paperwork and a background check.
Interview Questions: The department chair asked me what I wanted to do with my career.  This is the question you have to answer honestly to get the most out of the interview.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview which lasted 3 minutes. Generally went through your resume and tried to assess whether your skills were what they were looking for. They tell you about their project and you et to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How the cells are passages?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the volunteer program at Massachusetts General Hospital through their website. Signed up for the mandatory orientation session where I chose a date and time for the one on one interview. Positive/typical interview experience was received. I was asked the typical questions such as "Why do you want to volunteer at Mass. General Hospital?" "Tell me about your family...", etc.
Interview Questions: All questions were standard interview questions.

title: Online Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with employees and three levels of management for a total of five interviews spread on two days. Overall the process was easy enough, but the job description did not match the actual job.
Interview Questions: Some technical questions about websites

title: Systems Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and fluid. You meet with members of a few different departments. Not much difficulty question wise.
Interview Questions: There was none. Just be yourself and talk about interests that pertain to techonology.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Charlestown, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the Harvard portal. Received a phone call next day to arrange for an interview. The interview was 1 on 1 and fairly straightforward. Discussed skills and past experience, career goals, and work hour flexibility. The total process, including lunch with the current laboratory members, lasted approximately 3 hours. Received an offer the next day, which I accepted.
Interview Questions: One unexpected question that I was asked pertained to specifics of a recent scientific conference that I had attended. I was asked what my opinion of the keynote address was.

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted by HR and had a 20 minute phone interview with the HR rep. This was pleasant and mostly limited to answering the basic questions about my experiences, my strengths, my weaknesses, and then lastly the dreaded salary question. The HR rep was quite pushy about this when I said it would be negotiable and asked for my current salary. However, the interview was overall a pleasant experience (I guess as pleasant as it can be). 
I then was invited to have an in-person interview with the Head of the Department and 1 of the lead dietitians (I did not know she would be there). This was actually a lot less formal and serious than I expected. Oddly, the interviewers did not seem prepared with questions. The questions they did ask were a little more specific to my internship experience, my career interests, my clinical interests and experiences.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a bad multidisciplinary experience?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Email and phone call
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, just wanted a good assessment of my skills. I went to Bullfinch Temps to complete work (used as a hiring agency for parts of MasGen) and they gave a good overview of what to expect and if I had any further questions where I could reach someone to help.
Interview Questions: Previous experience specifically using computers

title: Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was easy I met with an HR woman and then my Boss she asked me basic interview questions. It was easy and short. My boss lied about the position and told me I would be working in a different department than I am.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Web Content Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: There are a lot of steps in the process. You have to meet with various groups and explain your work history on numerous occasions. You also have to be very patient, as the hiring process takes a long time. It is better to have a job already than to be unemployed and looking for work.
Interview Questions: How would you handle it if you were getting two competing sets of instructions from senior leadership in two departments?

title: Assistant In Neurology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my CV to the hospital, specifically to the head of the division that I was applying in and to the chair of the department.  I first had a phone interview and then was brought in for an in-person interview.  I met with several of the faculty members and had 30-45 minute interviews with all of them.
Interview Questions: What are your goals in terms of your career?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and sent my CV together with motivation letter, I got the Skype Interview, Presented my own research and publications, Some technical questions about skills and future plans
Interview Questions: about your own research and publications, future plans, educational background, computational skills

title: PSC III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Tedious and very long before position was offered after the first interview.  Was called back four times for different interviews since it was difficult to get everyone together that needed to meet me. First step was a phone interview.  Then met with the manager on two separate occasions, then was called back to meet with the doctors and other employees in the department.  Two weeks later, got a call with an offer.  Salary was non negotiable.
Interview Questions: How I handled working with difficult coworkers in the past.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. Got an email from the lab director. Set up a time to interview.
Interview Questions: Most questions were just about my resume and experience.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for an advertised *new* position(with job description);during interview process it became clear very quickly that the hiring manager still hadn't really thought out all the aspects of the job...as I was sitting there in front of him, he was thinking out loud about all the "extra" things they could tack on, "now that we'll have someone here to do(this)". Read:moving target. Every job does have its grey areas, granted, but they were in such a hurry to fill this one that they started getting people in to interview without the position being fully-formed.
Interview Questions:
While still thinking up extra duties, he had a thought bubble and then told me that they had another site I'd "probably need to monitor if there are problems they can't handle", and it was located 2 miles across town. Since pretty much anyone who's got a brain takes the train to work there, I responded quietly: "Okay, but just to clarify, if I'm taking the train in to work, what would be the best way I'd be expected to get there?"
Answer: "Oh, good question. Um, well, I guess we'll have to figure that out at some point..."

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Department of Imaging Informatics Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal candidate recommended by the person who was vacating this position, whom I had also worked with on a number of projects in the past and who was familiar with my abilities and skill set. The panel of people who I met with were relatively new to the department and had never had the opportunity to work with me before. The interview was panel-style and each of the members of the panel had a 2-page list of very specific (almost TOO specific) and multifaceted questions that I found very difficult to answer on-the-fly without giving them some amount of time and/or consideration to answer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Animal Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: submitted application, got called in for interview. I met with a technician who took me on a tour of the facility. I then met with the facility manager to continue the interview process. I waited about a month or so to hear back that I got the job.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths? How would I handle certain situations.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for position via skype while still in undergraduate. Tough interview but very straightforward, no surprises
Interview Questions: What are your thoughts and feelings on medicating people?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed Interview environment.  For the most part, we just reviewed what was already on my resume and discussed job requirements.  Both interviewers were pleasant and responsive in answering all my questions.
Interview Questions: What do you think is your greatest weakness.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process takes a little while, so be patient. I had an employee refer me for this position. There is an initial phone interview with human resources. Then an interview with the practice manager, then asked back to meet with the department head. The interview was quite typical. I went through my resume and talked about future goals.
Interview Questions:
Why do you think you will be a good fit at MGH?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 
Can you work independently and as a part of team?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. in both the interviewrer brought other postdocs to interview me. They were very interested to know what I can do for them. It was strange becaouse I was supposed to be independent, and i was promised Assistant professor possition within 4 months. I was more experienced than them, I didn't understand why they were so interested to know what I can do for them. And, indeed once I started to work there I understood.
Interview Questions: I was asked for my age among other things.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a good experience, we developed a very good rapport very quickly. I was referred by a colleague so the manager that interviewed me already new about me to some extent. Also I had a lot of experience for this positive so that was very helpful. The interview skills of the manager that met with me were great and that helped me relax immediately which is so important in any interview.  I also prepared by bringing copies of my resume and making notes about specific points that I felt were important to discuss.
Interview Questions: Most of the interview was centered around my experience and background. We also talked about working at MGH.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interested in learning whether or not a specific department had any openings so I sent an e-mail to HR of that department - she responded unfortunately there were no openings at the time - two days later I received an e-mail from the research coordinator asking for a phone interview, I was very confused as I was told there were no available positions, so I was unsure what I was even interviewing for - the phone interview was pretty standard; however, I was informed they were still figuring out their needs, and I would hear back within the next few weeks - I NEVER HEARD BACK EITHER WAY, I sent two follow-up e-mails, and called three times. I left two voicemails and spoke to the research coordinator herself who said I should hear back within the next week (at this point it had been 4 weeks since my phone interview), and again, no response, and no response to my follow up e-mail. I was very disappointed I had never heard either way, and thought this was very unprofessional from such a reputable hospital.
Interview Questions: All standard questions.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume via e-mail, was contacted a few weeks later for an in-person interview. They were very slow to get back to me. I had to follow up with multiple e-mails before I received any response. Additionally, I know one person who they initially didn't offer the job to, and then they called them back and offered the job. Very strange.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in researching XXX? Tell me about past research projects?

title: IV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called and asked to interview. First I had a phone interview with HR then proceeded to interview with the Nurse Manager of the IV Department in person. The interview was not very lengthy as I can recall, but thorough. It took place in a small office which may seem a little untraditional, but to me seemed to be a little bit more comfortable and was easier to communicate with the nurse manager. The process I thought was a little lengthy as it took maybe a month or more to hear back, but I did end up getting the job!
Interview Questions: What qualities I think are important in a work place.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (South Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: tough. You have to prepare
Interview Questions: why do you chose this place

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and very general. Met with the HR person first. Then the boss/ head nurse. Everyone described their roles and experiences on the floor. This was followed by them asking me about my experiences. The boss also showed me around the floor.
Interview Questions:
Q: Explain your experience in healthcare
Q: How many years of experience do you have

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Charlestown, MA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview takes about 1 day. They will ask you about your prior experience on your resume just to see if you fully understand what you were doing. Usually you will get to meet the entire team and walkthrough the lab during the interview.
Interview Questions: Past experience, projects etc

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions. Hiring manager was very open and honest. He explained clearly the expectations for this job role. He was a good listener and very friendly as well. He was willing to hire right candidate even though he/she don't have enough experience. However, he was keen in the candidate expressing passion and interest for the job
Interview Questions: 1. Why are you interested in this job?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
phone interview first and provide basic information of education and experience including volunteer experience.
face to  face interview with the PI. more details about the job requirement and  functions.
Interview Questions: the weakess

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy interview, and was offered the job via phone call within a week.  However, the interviewer asked me to confirm the salary that I negotiated during the interview with another manager, then emailed me to "follow up" a few minutes later - and rescinded the offer.  Totally unprofessional.  Will not interview here again.
Interview Questions: Usual questions about previous research management experience.

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit a resume via HR. The employer emailed me to set up an in person interview. The in person interview started with an initial interview with the current coordinator. Afterwards the PI of the study and a second coordinator joined us for a panel interview.
Interview Questions:
How do you feel about working with sensitive patient populations?
Tell us about your past patient experience?
This job involves a lot of fast paced multitasking - How will you handle that?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Fairly generic, get to know you interview. Went for one in-person interview and was offered the job soon afterwards. There was no room for negotiation, start date or salary, but was a pretty standard process. Interview was with other Clinical Research Coordinators and then with a couple of the doctors that you would be working directly with.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research. Why are you interested in this job? If you had unlimited money, what research would you do?

title: OR Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was relatively quick. The management is young and understanding, but a bit intimidating during the panel interview. I received an offer within 30 days of applying. HR didn't communicate very clearly, but this wasn't important because of the direct communication with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time where you lead a work unit and experienced challenges?

title: Biostatistics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very friendly.  The direct supervisor was very knowledgeable about the subject matter.  The research group dynamics is very good too.  People there are very open to new comers with different culture/background.  I overall think the interview process is not very hard but you need to do your homework on what they are looking for.  The hospital is a huge one and have many many cutting edge research centers with research fellows doing very advanced work to cure the hardest diseases.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Emailed resume as response to job posting, heard back two weeks later by phone and email to schedule interview for the following week.

Interview was at 9 am and started on time. I met with a current research assistant who was very friendly, did not ask much, just for a brief overview of my experience. She told me a little bit about the position.

Next, met with the lab director. We spoke more in-depth about my experience and the position. He was very approachable, not intimidating at all.

Last, I met with a post-doc in the lab. She hadn't been given a copy of my CV previously so I gave her a copy. She glanced it over and asked a few questions about various positions, then asked more about my career aspirations. She seemed nice but unprepared for the interview due to miscommunication.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process involved an interview with several of the organizaition's key critical members, including director level management, senior level management, and program level management. The interview process was thorough and involved several questions with regard to prior skills and experiences, educational background, as well as situational questions (e.g. conflict resolution strategies, strengths-weaknesses, etc.)
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly straight forward.  Emailed letter of interest and updated resume.  Then phone phone interview and 1 to 1 interview in person.  It may have helped that a current research person referred me for  the position.
