Interview Questions: Standard questions about my experience and interest in the position.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Down to earth; open conversation; dialogue. The Program director had carefully read my resume and truly wanted to find out how my previus experiences could help in the job I was interviewing for. He seemed willing to give me a chance even though I did not have direct healthcare experience before.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews with 5 different people
Typical quetions: why are you switching jobs? Do you know about XYZ? How long?
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you over the other candidates?

title: Materials Management Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Easily Done through High School, and hired without company interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well. The group was professional and the overall culture of the group seemed positive.  The HR review process took several weeks. The HR representative did not have my full information or application, even though I was an internal Partners Applicant. This made for a bumbling phone call when I received the offer, with particular emphasis on salary.
Interview Questions: General questions regarding pertinent experience.

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a position directly from the MGH hospital website. Within a week I got an email from the scientist that would be my potential boss, just clarifying a few things on my resume. We emailed back and forth a couple time and then she set up a phone interview with me. The phone interview lasted about 20 minutes and she asked questions involving my background and education, but spent the majority of the interview on what goals I had for the future. I was less prepared to answer these questions-which were a lot about research goals, continuing my education, and specific areas of interest. My take on it was that they wanted to give someone the opportunity that had a very specific goal for future research.
Interview Questions: Describe how you contributed your own ideas to your adviser's research project?

title: Staff Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online-- very easy to apply to dozens of jobs without a cover letter!
Interview Questions: What would I do if I needed my boss's signature immediately but wasn't able to locate him as he was in a rural area of a poor country?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very low stress interview. It doesn't matter how well you can do your job, they mainly looks for individuals who will be their friends.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my mems and microfluidics experience and details on the current projects. Was also asked to explain in detail all the things written on my resume. I was asked for a very easy Labview code as well.
Interview Questions: Can you explain your microfluidic experience in building a fuel cell?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Meet first with the hiring director, then meet with the project director, then with the team
Interview Questions: Describe your expectations over the next 5 years

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with Recruiter followed by another phone interview with hiring manager 1 week later. 2 weeks later, interviewed with panel of employees I would be working with. 2 weeks later, accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your management style?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a pleasant phone conversation with the hiring scientist, going over my background and the expectations for the position.  This was followed by an oral presentation with questions in the department seminar.  After a few days, an offer came by e-mail with a stated salary.  A copy of the research proposal was also e-mailed to me.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.  All questions pertained to my background and familiarity with particular scientific techniques.  There were no surprises; the questions were straight-forward.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at staffing firm with Director and Finance Manager. Interview Structure 1:1.  Two 45 minute interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe how coming from a large public firm you will be able to add value to a non for profit environment?

title: Bioinformatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts General Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2007
Interview Descriptions: The interview was thorough and welcoming. I was treated with care and understanding and my duties were clearly explained to me. The actual hiring process took longer than I would have liked, but the decision on whether they wanted to hire me was quick. After that decision there was a long wait as the HR department let me drip through the many filters of bureaucracy. Once that was finished the work environment proved to be very nice.
Interview Questions: What do you know about linkage disequilibrium and it's affect on human genetic disease?
